verses.verse: (Gen. 46:11; Ex. 6:16-19; Num. 3:15; 1 Chr. 6:1, 16) And these are those who were numbered of the Levites according to their families: of Gershon, the family of the Gershonites; of Kohath, the family of the Kohathites; of Merari, the family of the Merarites.

These are the families of the Levites: the family of the Libnites, the family of the Hebronites, the family of the Mahlites, the family of the Mushites, and the family of the Korathites. And Kohath begot Amram.
The name of Amram’s wife was (Ex. 2:1, 2; 6:20) Jochebed the daughter of Levi, who was born to Levi in Egypt; and to Amram she bore Aaron and Moses and their sister Miriam.
(Num. 3:2) To Aaron were born Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
And (Lev. 10:1, 2; Num. 3:3, 4; 1 Chr. 24:2) Nadab and Abihu died when they offered profane fire before the LORD.

(Num. 3:39) Now those who were numbered of them were twenty-three thousand, every male from a month old and above; (Num. 1:49) for they were not numbered among the other children of Israel, because there was (Num. 18:20, 23, 24) no inheritance given to them among the children of Israel.
These are those who were numbered by Moses and Eleazar the priest, who numbered the children of Israel (Num. 26:3) in the plains of Moab by the Jordan, across from Jericho.

(Num. 14:29-35; Deut. 2:14-16; Heb. 3:17) But among these there was not a man of those who were numbered by Moses and Aaron the priest when they numbered the children of Israel in the (Num. 1:1-46) Wilderness of Sinai.

For the LORD had said of them, “They (Num. 14:26-35; (1 Cor. 10:5, 6)) shall surely die in the wilderness.” So there was not left a man of them, (Num. 14:30) except Caleb the son of Jephunneh and Joshua the son of Nun.

Inheritance Laws Then came the daughters of (Num. 26:33; 36:1, 11; Josh. 17:3) Zelophehad the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, from the families of Manasseh the son of Joseph; and these were the names of his daughters: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
And they stood before Moses, before Eleazar the priest, and before the leaders and all the congregation, by the doorway of the tabernacle of meeting, saying:

“Our father (Num. 14:35; 26:64, 65) died in the wilderness; but he was not in the company of those who gathered together against the LORD, (Num. 16:1, 2) in company with Korah, but he died in his own sin; and he had no sons.
Why should the name of our father be (Deut. 25:6) removed from among his family because he had no son? (Josh. 17:4) Give us a possession among our father’s brothers.”
So Moses (Ex. 18:13-26) brought their case before the LORD.
And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying:

“The daughters of Zelophehad speak what is right; (Num. 36:2; Josh. 17:4) you shall surely give them a possession of inheritance among their father’s brothers, and cause the inheritance of their father to pass to them.
And you shall speak to the children of Israel, saying: ‘If a man dies and has no son, then you shall cause his inheritance to pass to his daughter.
If he has no daughter, then you shall give his inheritance to his brothers.
If he has no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to his father’s brothers.

And if his father has no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to the relative closest to him in his family, and he shall possess it.’ ” And it shall be to the children of Israel (Num. 35:29) a statute of judgment, just as the LORD commanded Moses.

Joshua the Next Leader of Israel Now the LORD said to Moses: (Num. 33:47; Deut. 3:23-27; 32:48-52; 34:1-4) “Go up into this Mount Abarim, and see the land which I have given to the children of Israel.
And when you have seen it, you also (Num. 20:12, 24, 28; 31:2; Deut. 10:6; 34:5, 6) shall be gathered to your people, as Aaron your brother was gathered.

For in the Wilderness of Zin, during the strife of the congregation, you (Num. 20:12, 24; Deut. 1:37; 32:51; Ps. 106:32, 33) rebelled against My command to hallow Me at the waters before their eyes.” (These are the (Ex. 17:7) waters of Meribah, at Kadesh in the Wilderness of Zin.)
